page.title: 06Education
page.content: Pupils, who until about 1965 were mainly from the farming and forestry community, now come from a much broader field. The oil industry has spilled over as far west as Keig and there have been numbers of "immigrant" children viz. Australian, American, South American, Canadian, South African, Dutch - even a Singalese at one point - also English, Welsh and Irish children. The school has visiting specialist teachers in Art, Drama, Home Economics, Music and Physical Education. A remedial teacher comes once weekly for pupils with "learning" difficulties and a speech therapist is available as required. The present Headmistress has held the post for 16 years and now teaches all seven classes, ages from 4+ to 12 years.
